doc.description: This directive controls whether the httpd may use memory-mapping if it needs to read the contents of a file during delivery.
This directive controls whether httpd may use the sendfile support from the kernel to transmit file contents to the client.
MIME content-type that will be sent if the server cannot determine a type in any other way
Enables HTTP persistent connections
Amount of time the server will wait for subsequent requests on a persistent connection
Determine maximum number of internal redirects and nested subrequests
Restricts the total size of the HTTP request body sent from the client
Limits the number of HTTP request header fields that will be accepted from the client
Limits the size of the HTTP request header allowed from the client
Limit the size of the HTTP request line that will be accepted from the client
Limits the size of an XML-based request body
Controls the verbosity of the ErrorLog
Number of requests allowed on a persistent connection
Designates an IP address for name-virtual hosting
Configures what features are available in a particular directory
Interaction between host-level access control and user authentication
Technique for locating the interpreter for CGI scripts
Email address that the server includes in error messages sent to the client
Hostname and port that the server uses to identify itself
Configures the footer on server-generated documents
Configures the Server HTTP response header
Forces all matching files to be processed by a handler
Sets the filters that will process client requests and POST input
Sets the filters that will process responses from the server
Amount of time the server will wait for certain events before failing a request
Determines the behaviour on TRACE requests
Configures how the server determines its own name and port
